The atmosphere is nice and sunny, it's in a house and very open with a large patio to eat on. There is a long list of fresh lebanese drinks so skip the soda! I had a very unusually tasty mint/rose/lime/orange (something else I'm forgetting) lemonade. I had vegetarian meze plate and my favorite part was the falafels they were well seasoned  and well beyond the typical bland friend chick pea. I also liked their hummus a lot (I prefered it to the babaganoush) it was seasoned so tastfully (I got a stong taste of tahini, cumin ?, and sumac)  ~ again well beyond what hummus usually is (bland mashed chick peas).

Don't walk, jog, or run to this place, jump in your car and step on the gas. Seriously! I don't know where to start with Elie's, you will be so excited after you have a meal there, before you even leave, you will already be planning your second trip, it IS THAAAAT good! First off, SUPER accommodating. Our group was close to 25 and they basically reserved about 70% of their space for us! Not only that, they even split checks! We had two servers regularly checking in on us and keeping up with our fast and crazy pace. Almost everyone in our party ordered an appetizer (some even two!), a drink, an entree, and dessert. Some people were getting multiple drinks. I don't know how they did it, but they didn't miss a beat, it was impressive! The atmosphere is simple and small. The whole place is pretty tiny with not a lot of decor, but after eating their food, you can tell where the real investment in Elie's is. So on to the most important part - the food! Oh my gosh, there are just too few places in Columbia that give you that kick and that feeling of consistent foodgasms, but Elie's will leave you MORE than satisfied but wanting more at the same time, if that's possible. On just my side of the table, amongst 5 very hungry people, we probably sampled close to 40% of the menu in just our first setting. Everything, I mean, EVERYTHING, was insanely delicious! We couldn't stop throwing food in our mouth, like vultures, like crazy people who hadn't eaten in years, we were on a food gorging marathon, it was absolutely ridiculous. I loved all the appetizers I tried, but the spinach and feta pie was a home-run. I ordered the eggplant pita for my entree, and it was soo excellently seasoned and cooked, though at that point, I had inhaled four different appetizers and was completely stuffed, I couldn't control myself and still finished my meal! We were on a roll and went ahead and got all three desserts on the menu and were lucky enough to sample their Lebanese baklava (it IS better than Greek baklava imo!), their strawberry cake (YUM, YUM!), and even their dark chocolate cake (oooh lala!). I wish I had found out the name of the cook, because that man or woman back there, really knew what they were doing, everything was sooo freakin absolutely amazing. I will absolutely without a doubt go back. Oh and people in our group who had never had Lebanese or Middle Eastern food and came out loved everything they ordered as well. The food pleased everyone!

There needs to be another star added to this.  This place is Columbia's hidden treasure.  The food is so fresh and so flavorful!  Dont even get me started on the deserts...  They are beyond amazing!  A fair warning about the coffee though... you wont sleep for a week once you drink it.Service is superb and the quality of the food is the best.  I have spent 5 times as much on some restaurants in Columbia, but only for a quarter of the amount of satisfaction I get from here.
Authentic food great lunch prices and portion sizes. Always a good favorite dish is the Shish Taouk! Try it!!!

Delicious creative fare with excellent service. Heads and Tails above the apathetic renderings of Al-amir and the Mediterranean Cafe. I actually like the aforementioned restaurants but Elie's puts them in the shade. I wish the location was more in the mainstream so it would get more recognition. If you like food that is adventurousand not afraid to be bold, give Elie's a chance. With a preponderance of Greek restaurants is the area, this place outshines them all in their Mediterranean cuisine. I suggest they they give restaurant.com or groupon a chance to spread the word.
Bellis House of Pizza: Mrs. C.

I could seriously eat their Greek salad with grilled chicken and house dressing daily. It's that delicious and huge!!! Also, try their baklava cheesecake. Holy. Crap!!! So, so good!!! The owners and staff are incredibly nice and are great at their jobs. Go here and eat!
John G.
I've beenhere a few times now and have always experienced good food with fast and friendly service.I definitely recommend.
Clay L.

This was a pleasant surprise while visiting some friends in Columbia. Bellis has a good mix of items on their menu, from burgers and gyros to moussaka and pizza Bellis has a variety of food to offer.I went off on a limb and decided to try their greek burger. This ended up being a fantastic option with a great sized burger that had feta/bacon/lettuce/tomato/and some of their greek dressing on it.The burger had a fantastic mix of flavors, the meat was juicy and the dressing gave it some good acidity and tang. The only downside to the meal was the fries, they were ok, nothing special just frozen steak fries.Everyone at the table left happy, if were in the area again I could see us going back.
Amy Lauren S.

Last weekend, my husband and I were in Lexington with some friends and we went out to Belli's House of Pizza for dinner. Our friends went there for pizza earlier in the week and liked it, and they had the right idea. Belli's is a local joint and seems to be family-owned, mom and pop, and the food was delicious. Like the name says, it's pizza restaurant, but they also serve Greek food like sandwiches, salads, calzones, and traditional Greek dishes like moussaka, souvlaki, gyros, and spanokopita. If you're not in the mood for pizza, you should still check it out because they offer a LOT of menu options. I had the spanokopita entree, which came with garlic bread and a house salad. The house salads are simple, they don't come with feta (but you can order it- we did), but the dressing is delicious. I like how it came on the side, and all of us agreed it was some of the best Greek dressing we've had. The salads were pretty large and came out quickly. The garlic bread was also buttery, hot, and tasty. The spanokopita I had was some of the best I have tried. The phylo dough was light and fluffy, and it was full of spinach. I could not finish my spanokopita but it was still good reheated the next day. It was a huge piece portion for only $10.95. Belli's is a great place for authentic Greek food- or many other foods- on a budget. The restaurant is not super fancy on the outside or inside, but it is one of those hidden gems beside a Publix in a shopping center. We would definitely return the next time we're in the area.
Emily E.
Meh.  Greek salad was just OK.  Dressing needed more flavor.  Kept adding more to no avail.  Got the Tuscan pizza and it was good but prices here and atmosphere won't entice me to return.
Russel G.
Delisous calamari and the calzone we had was amazing. Friendly staff. Definitely will go back
Keegan C.

This is a freat go to for greek pizza. Very friendly family owned. I usually opt for the Greek salad and a Pepperoni Pizza, excellent crust. I have also tried some of the pasta dishes all of which were delicious
Ms. P Y.
This place is awesome great customer service the menu is exceptional, so many item to choose from wonderful atmosphere, will definitely be back the people are very friendly
Lillian C.

Portions are ample, service is fantastic (local mom and pop joint.) Free Captain's Wafers at the table. Calamari is great (and quite affordable) and pizza looks pretty decent, but I'd steer clear of the Greek though. The kebab tasted a bit freezer burned and the chicken was something that could have been executed in a college dorm room (used to make something remarkably similar as an undergrad using herbs de provence and the chicken tenderloins). Pita is the standard food service style flatbreads you get a gyro joint. I cried a little on the inside that two mediocre greek entrees and a calamari basket came out to 37 dollars. Next time, I'll do as the locals and order pizza.
Jennifer B.
Its ok....not a fan of the goo on a cracker...at least bring a plate. Pizza was solid but better is down the road.
Celeste P.
We had the Greek pizza and it was very tasty and mouthwatering.  Highly recommend this restaurant. They make a salad dressing that is outstanding.
Kelley H.
So much more than pizza!!! Great authentic Greek & Italian dinners. Wine & beer as well. Very needed here in Lexington.
Ralph S.

Excellent!! We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on our way to VA. We reviewed Yelp for local restaurants and found Bellis.  It was close and it had gotten good reviews. My wife, Susan, was craving Greek cuisine so we ordered take out.     I wish they had told us about their specials on the phone.  When I walked in I read they were featuring potato soup and liver and onions.  I would have ordered the liver and onions special but we had already placed our order. I did, however, get the soup to go, Lamb Gyro, and souvlaki. All terrific.    We wanted to eat in the room after a five hour trip.    The staff was very friendly and attentive.  I, of course, tipped the young waitress very well  who bagged our food and made certain it was correct. I was very happy.
Greg P.
Great food with exceptional service. I had the Lasagna. My wife had the souvlaki. We were both very pleased and will certainly return when we get the chance.
Rocky R.

There is nothing bad on the menu.  You can't go wrong with the house special or buffalo chicken pizza.  The super sub with house dressing hits the spot no matter if it's for lunch or dinner.Make sure to try the house dressing on some crackers located on every table.  It's addicting.  This is the favorite Greek restaurant my wife and I go to and go there at least once a week.
Wardlaw F.
Some of the best food in the area. This place is much bigger than it looks, has a really friendly and direct staff as well as a feeling of family. Will be a constant place for us
Joel W.
Dinner: gyro sandwich, potatoes and salad. Food was good, not mind-blowing, but good. Service was fine, restaurant is nice inside, very comfy. Good crowd. I would go back.
Rebekah P.

Great little place at the old Parthenon location.  This has a very small store front, so that you are very surprised at how large it really is when you walk in the door. So far, we have only eaten there once, but we will definitely be back. typical Italian and Greek mash up with salads, subs and burgers added for good measure.  We have not had their pizza yet, but going by the steady stream of customers coming in to pick up their take-out orders, it must be pretty darn good! Casual but not divey.  We felt right at home. Can't wait to try some more dishes on their menu, and of course, the pizza.
Brandy W.

Bellis is now my favorite local pizza.  It may be the best in the Columbia area, but I can't say that for sure.  We ordered a salad with Greek dressing and the Tuscan pizza with red pizza sauce instead of the olive oil base.  I have been a Ray's fan for a long time, but this even tops Ray's!  Their salads are MUCH better than Ray's and they have more interesting pizza choices/toppings.  The crispy light crust was so wonderful and dipped int eh Greek dressing I was in heaven.  I ate everyone else's crusts!  I can't believe this undiscovered jewel has been sitting in the where many other dinky takeout places once were!  The prices were a little better too.
